abstract: Kenneth D. Lewis, the chief executive of Bank of America, testified under oath that the Federal Reserve chairman, Ben Bernanke, and then-Treasury Secretary Henry M. Paulson pressured him to not discuss its plan to buy Merrill Lynch, The Wall Street Journal reported.

lead_paragraph: Update | 6:29 p.m. The head of Bank of America changed his mind about trying to pull out of its deal to buy Merrill Lynch after Henry M. Paulson Jr., the Treasury secretary at the time, suggested that the bank’s management and board could be removed if that happened, Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo of New York said in a letter to Congress made public on Thursday.

headline.main: Treasury Pushed BofA to Close Merrill Deal, Cuomo Says
